programme.title: The MI5 Spy and the IRA: Operation Chiffon
programme.desc: How an MI5 officer put his life and career on the line to encourage the IRA to make peace.

programme.title: Love, Faith & Me S1 (2/5)
programme.desc: Chiedza is a Muslim convert. Can her new faith help in finding love and a husband?

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars S2 (1/8)
programme.desc: Gordon challenges 12 food and drink entrepreneurs to stage banquets celebrating Scotland.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and the teams are in Shropshire. Experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper lead the reds and blues as they compete for bargains at an antiques fair in Oswestry. Meanwhile, Charlie visits a family firm in Llangollen who are crafting wood to make standing frames for people with spinal injuries.

programme.title: The Bidding Room S4 (16/30)
programme.desc: Five dealers bid to buy a ride-on train and a rugby shirt from a famous film.

programme.title: Take a Hike (Innes's Walk, Sligachan) S2 (10/15)
programme.desc: «Innes's Walk, Sligachan»Musician Innes hopes to wow the group with a mountain walk through the Glen of Sligachan.

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital S1 (5/10)
programme.desc: A labrador suffers an extreme allergic reaction, and a dachshund has a case of tremors.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Impossible S5
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts Impossible - the quiz with a third dimension. In traditional quiz shows, questions have just right answers and wrong answers. But here, there's a twist - the impossible answer. It's not just wrong, it couldn't possibly be right. 18 contestants compete for a possible £10,000 jackpot. Right answers take them closer to the big money, but if at any stage they give an impossible answer, they will immediately be knocked out. The winner of every show faces the £10,000 question. Three right answers will trigger a spectacular cascade of 10,000 pound coins from a giant exclamation mark, but a single impossible answer means they will leave with nothing.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a general knowledge quiz featuring the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain (Bristol) (n°12)
programme.desc: «Bristol»Si and Dave are in the West Country, sampling local cider.

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers (Le Mississippi, indomptable géant) S1 (3/3)
programme.desc: «Le Mississippi, indomptable géant»From Frozen North to steamy South ? the surprising story of the river that unites the USA.

programme.title: My Unique B&B (Stacey's Bus) S2 (13/15)
programme.desc: «Stacey's Bus»In Monmouthshire, Simon and his team take on a 1980s bus conversion.

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect S3
programme.desc: A couple remodel their house after choosing a virtual reality design.

programme.title: Flog It ! S16
programme.desc: Flog It! comes from Glemham Hall in the Suffolk countryside, which dates back to the Tudor era. Antiques expert David Fletcher discovers some scripts from the television series Lovejoy, which featured a Suffolk antique dealer, and Jonathan Pratt spots some Beatles bobbing-head dolls designed to fit in a car. Paul Martin follows in the footsteps of local composer Benjamin Britten.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games decanter, or will they be tempted by the House of Games kitchen composter?

programme.title: B&B By the Sea (Adam Woodyatt) S1 (3/15)
programme.desc: «Adam Woodyatt»It's the turn of actor Adam Woodyatt to check into the B&B.

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop S1 (4/6)
programme.desc: Jay Blades' workshop makes furniture to thank a mental health mentor and a youth worker.

programme.title: Banjo: Designing the Hebrides (Fish Shop) S1 (1/6)
programme.desc: «Fish Shop»Banjo is brought in to transform a beloved family fish shop on the Isle of Mull.

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year S1 (1/6)
programme.desc: The judges, led by Owain Wyn Evans, start in the north east.

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds S1 (7/8)
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon Ryan Mathew performs awake brain surgery on a patient with a large tumour.

programme.title: Detectorists S3 (n°1)
programme.desc: Lance's flat isn't his own, while Andy's stuck with the mother-in-law.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Kirsty Wark.
